statement: Let \(A\) be one of the two distinct points of intersection of two unequal coplanar circles \(C_1\) and \(C_2\) with centers \(O_1\) and \(O_2\). One common tangent touches \(C_1\) at \(P_1\) and \(C_2\) at \(P_2\); the other touches \(C_1\) at \(Q_1\) and \(C_2\) at \(Q_2\). Let \(M_1\) be the midpoint of \(P_1Q_1\) and \(M_2\) the midpoint of \(P_2Q_2\). Prove that \(\angle O_1AO_2 = \angle M_1AM_2\).

Let \(a, b, c\) be positive integers, no two of which have a common divisor greater than 1. Show that \(2abc - ab - bc - ca\) is the largest integer which cannot be expressed in the form \(xbc + yca + zab\) with non-negative integers \(x, y, z\).

Let \(ABC\) be an equilateral triangle and \(E\) the set of all points on segments \(AB, BC, CA\) (including \(A, B, C\)). Determine whether, for every partition of \(E\) into two disjoint subsets, at least one subset contains the vertices of a right-angled triangle. Justify your answer.
Is it possible to choose 1983 distinct positive integers, all \(\leq 10^5\), such that no three are consecutive terms of an arithmetic progression? Justify your answer.

Let \(a, b, c\) be the lengths of the sides of a triangle. Prove that
\[ a^2b(a - b) + b^2c(b - c) + c^2a(c - a) \geq 0 \]
and determine when equality occurs.
